newsitem.title: JAPAN: JAL jumbo aborts takeoff in Tokyo, 22 injured.
newsitem.headline: JAL jumbo aborts takeoff in Tokyo, 22 injured.

text.p: A Japan Airlines Boeing 747-400 was forced to abort its takeoff from Tokyo's Narita airport on Friday, slightly injuring 22 passengers, airport police said.

The pilot of the Frankurt-bound JAL flight 407 brought the plane to an emergency stop after noticing that one of the four plane engines was malfunctioning, an official at the Civil Aviation Bureau of the Ministry of Transport told Reuters.
The manoeuvre caused the brakes to overheat and created smoke around the plane's wheels, but investigators were not sure whether there was actually a fire, the official said.
Police initially said 23 people were injured, two of them seriously. The incident forced the temporary closure of one of Narita's two runways.
All 333 passengers and 20 crew on board were evacuated using emergency chutes, and those with minor injuries were taken to a nearby hospital, the airport police official said.
In June, three people were killed and 110 injured when a Garuda Indonesia McDonnell Douglas DC-10 crashed on take-off from Fukuoka in southern Japan.
